Entries.default:
The lectern reads:

"The gods lost them, but we will find them again."

The lectern reads:

"They think their difference is a blessing when it is but a brand."

The lectern reads:

"Death comes for all in time."

The lectern reads:

"In their fear, they will give her power and ask for safety. But she will give them only orders."
It looks as though a book could be placed here.
[Place The History of Eora, Volume XI: The Rediscovery of Yezuha.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume XII: The Reclamation of the Living Lands.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume XIII: The Last Ice Age.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume XIV: The Vanishing of Godlikes.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume XV: The Throne of Woedica.]
[Place The History of Eora, Volume XVI: The End of the Gods.]
[Leave.]
There is already a book resting in the indentation.

A simple adra contraption rests before you. A lever on its side appears to be the only way to interact with it.
[Pull the lever.]
[Leave.]
The lever locks into place with a wet, satisfying click.
The lever immediately springs back up, slamming into your hand.
[Smell it.]
The contraption exudes the sharp odor of metal, polish, and a hint of old meat.
A sharp tone erupts from the device, and the lecterns around the room emanate a bright and sudden light.
